p: Community-acquired pneumonia (CAP) is a major cause of morbidity and mortality in adults [ 1, 2]. Worldwide, lower respiratory tract infections (LRTIs) including pneumonia are the third highest cause of death in adults, and 1.8 million people aged â‰¥15 years die from pneumonia every year [ 3]. Studies have shown that the risk of CAP increases with age and is highest among the elderly, indicating that the burden of this health risk grows as the global population ages [ 4- 6]. Special attention must be paid to CAP in Southeast Asia (SEA), a region facing rapid demographic transition [ 7].
